Posted By: iraah9 (1/30/2011 7:16:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Guys, I was at the prerelease last night & my 3rd round opponent was playing a really REALLY bad deck. On turn 6, I had 18 life & he had 9 life & 6 poison. My turn, I had 6 creatures to his 3, a 2/4 flier, two 1/1 myr, two 2/2's w/infect & a 6/6 after metalcraft & a c clasp for prolif. I swing with everyone. He blocks the 6/6, & both of the infected, he's down to 5 life. I prolif, he gets poison cntr #7 & loses a chump. His turn, he summons Herald & checks to me. My turn, I unsummon Herald, prolif & swing with everyone. He sacs a weenie to prevent most of the damage, shatters my clasp but not before he gets his 9th poison cntr & is also down to 1 health. His turn, summons accorder paladin & the herald, gives his creatures haste & swings with everything. I drop to 1 life point lose my infected creatures & he goes to 15. My turn, dead draw, swing for 5 & he wins the game. This card is a beast. Trust in that.

posts.post_content:
I like raptor better. It has a useful creature type and is just plain huge. And doesn't need to attack to grant lifelink. And has good art...  
At least Dragons have [Dragonspeaker Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonspeaker Shaman) and [Dragonstorm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dragonstorm). Demons have [Blood speaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blood speaker) (and some other more crappy ogres.) Angels have nothing but people are still playing angel tribal decks, you see one every now and then. I say throw those nutjobs a bone and print an angel lord :D

posts.post_content: @Lorendorky: You sound a bit scorned. Yes, a lot of the cards in this set can be played well in Commander (EDH), but if the set has any issues it's not because of any cards built with Commander / EDH in mind. This card should cost {4}{W}{W}, and then it'd be more playable. If anything it's a Timmy Angel for Angel lovers. I love Angels, though I hate [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel) because I won't pay that much for a single card, but I don't really like this thing. But I'm sure there are Angel-loving Timmy's out there who would not to give all of his or her non-flying attackers flying and lifelink and gain a bunch of life in the process. It's a fun card for casual, I think, which in no way means it sucks just because it won't be played by competitive types.
posts.html:
@Lorendorky: You sound a bit scorned. Yes, a lot of the cards in this set can be played well in Commander (EDH), but if the set has any issues it's not because of any cards built with Commander / EDH in mind. But I'm sure there are Angel-loving Timmy's out there who would not to give all of his or her non-flying attackers flying and lifelink and gain a bunch of life in the process. It's a fun card for casual, I think, which in no way means it sucks just because it won't be played by competitive types.

Posted By: CrunchyGrandma (7/11/2011 12:45:04 AM)

posts.post_content:
This guy can indeed seriously turn a game around full circle.
  
   
I played my first booster draft last night, and I won my second round because of him.
  
   
I had about 6 life left, with maybe 4-5 poison counters, and my opponent had about 16 life with 0 poison. On the field, I had [Kemba's Legion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kemba's Legion), [Victory's Herald](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Victory's Herald), and I had just summoned [Flameborn Hellion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Flameborn Hellion). I then cast [Assault Strobe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Assault Strobe) on my Hellion, and then attacked with all three. He had nothing with flying or reach.
  
   
Like I said, full circle.
posts.html:

He had nothing with flying or reach.

Like I said, full circle.

Posted By: Richard_Hawk (2/8/2011 11:09:27 AM)

posts.post_content:
Give it [Sword of Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Vengeance)!  
  
That nets you a non-legendar, standard legal, *almost* Akroma for 9cmc. Which isn't really that crazy. Especially if the sword's already been on the board for a few turns. I run singletons of both her and [Sun Titan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sun Titan) in my WW just in case it gets to the late game.  
  
Herald + [Sword of Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Vengeance) + [Armored Ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armored Ascension) made my Mono-Red friend very sad. Having said that...a 1/1 with Sword of Vengeance and Armored Ascension ends the game just as easily; only without preposterous amounts of life gain.
